intro: Huttonella prona, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils. Huttonella prona plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
